snippet: New data offer more signs of a cooling economy and give policymakers room to support growth.
abstract: Chinese government announces further signs of a cooling economy, with year-on-year price inflation dropping to 3.2 percent in February from 4.5 percent in January; trend gives leaders far more leeway to manage the economy and continue with a policy of loosening lending or cutting interest rates to help sustain economic growth.
lead_paragraph: New data offer more signs of a cooling economy and give policymakers room to support growth.

headline.main: In China, Inflation Eases as Growth Slows
headline.print_headline: In China, Inflation Eases as Growth Slows, Raising Chance of Stimulus
